help.intro: Implements a staircase light logic with KNX integration, handling timer, pre-warning, manual override and blocking.
help.trigger_ga: A rising edge (value = 1) on the trigger GA starts the timer. If enabled, a value of 0 will immediately cancel the cycle.
help.extend: The "On new trigger" option controls how subsequent pulses behave: restart the timer, extend the remaining time or ignore the pulse.
help.off: When override is active the timer is paused and the light stays on. Blocking disables new pulses and optionally forces the output off.
help.output_ga: Output GA is driven with DPT 1.001 by default. Configure other DPTs if required.
help.status_ga: Status GA mirrors the stair light state (and the pre-warning flag when enabled).
help.override_ga: Override GA keeps the light on while true and suspends the timer.
help.block_ga: Block GA prevents new activations. When false, normal behaviour resumes.
help.prewarn_desc: Enable a pre-warning to alert occupants before the light turns off. You can either flash the output or toggle the status GA.
help.events_desc: When enabled the node emits structured events (trigger, extend, prewarn, timeout, override, block) with the remaining time and state information.
